meanings.definition: The state, fact, quality, or condition of being singular.
meanings.sent1: In mathematics, a singularity is a unique point that stands out from the rest.
meanings.sent2: The singularity of her voice made her a standout performer.
meanings.sent3: The singularity of the situation made everyone stop and stare.
meanings.sent4: His artwork captured the singularity of each individual flower in the garden.
meanings.sent5: The singularity of the diamond's sparkle caught everyone's attention.

meanings.definition: A point at which a function takes an infinite value, especially in space-time when matter is infinitely dense, as at the center of a black hole.
meanings.sent1: Scientists study the singularity at the center of a black hole to understand its immense gravity.
meanings.sent2: The concept of a singularity in physics can be mind-boggling for many.
meanings.sent3: At the party, the singularity of the chocolate fountain attracted all the guests.
meanings.sent4: The singularity of emotions in the room was palpable as the news spread.
meanings.sent5: The singularity of the star's collapse created a spectacular cosmic event.
